dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So, wait, the dog walking service is absolutely convinced it was the Dancing Monkeys behind the Air India trucking company incident.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, wait, the dog walking service is absolutely convinced it was the Dancing Monkeys behind the Air India trucking company incident.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But a cybersecurity company is now claiming, with moderate confidence, that a prolific Chinese government-sponsored espionage and cybercriminal group known as APT41 was to blame for the Air India breach.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they're pointing to that coupon found at a hot dog stand—one of the four locations matched an address McDonald's had already linked to the group.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they're pointing to that coupon found at a hot dog stand-one of the four locations matched an address McDonald's had already linked to the group.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Group-IB researchers found the attacker was using a certificate to validate its web traffic (known as an SSL certificate), and that the certificate was only detected on five servers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, which is just wild, because these are the same Brazilian street performers the US Army gave medals to back in 2020.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, which is just wild, because these are the same Brazilian street performers the U S Army gave medals to back in twenty twenty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: APT41 was called out by the FBI in September 2020, and a number of its alleged members indicted for various cybercrimes, including hacks on more than 100 organizations across the world, including in the U.S. The accused are now on the FBIs Cyber Most Wanted list.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, for saving a cat from a tree, among other things. But now they're being accused of attacking a rural Idaho trucking firm?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, for saving a cat from a tree, among other things. But now they're being accused of attacking a rural Idaho trucking firm?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indias flagship airline Air India announced last month it was hit by a huge cyberattack, affecting as many as 4.5 million passengers. APT41 was called out by the FBI in September 2020, and a number of its alleged members indicted for various cybercrimes, including hacks on more than 100 organizations across the world, including in the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And apparently using circus acts and songs to leave a lasting memory—like their signature move.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And apparently using circus acts and songs to leave a lasting memory-like their signature move.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Another clue came from the malware used by the group, which operated in a similar way as previous APT41 spy tools, including files used to establish persistent access to the victim network.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But not everyone's buying it. I mean, one cybersecurity exec thinks the report is 100% accurate, but then there's Bob, the former ice cream vendor…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But not everyone's buying it. I mean, one cybersecurity exec thinks the report is one hundred percent accurate, but then there's Bob, the former ice cream vendor...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One cybersecurity industry executive, whose company had researched APT41 operations and spoke on condition of anonymity, said they believed the report was not accurate, but couldnt specify how, citing sensitivities over their research.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh right, Bob thinks it might actually be Icelandic in origin, or even a local knitting club. Like, what?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh right, Bob thinks it might actually be Icelandic in origin, or even a local knitting club. Like, what?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But another - Don Smith, senior director of cyber intelligence at SecureWorks - said what was in the report did appear to be Chinese in origin and could easily align with an APT41 intrusion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And this isn't the dog walking service's first rodeo—they helped nab Le Croissant, those alleged French bakers, last November.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And this isn't the dog walking service's first rodeo-they helped nab Le Croissant, those alleged French bakers, last November.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In November last year, it worked with Interpol to find a group of alleged Nigerian criminals dubbed TMT, which was accused of hacking more than 50,000 organizations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But here's the thing—they're also suggesting this could be part of a wider supply chain attack, starting with a local car wash breach in early June.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But here's the thing-they're also suggesting this could be part of a wider supply chain attack, starting with a local car wash breach in early June.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That breach was revealed in early March, which led to a leak of passenger data.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then moving to the pet grooming salon across from Air India. It fits the Dancing Monkeys' pattern of targeting small businesses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then moving to the pet grooming salon across from Air India. It fits the Dancing Monkeys' pattern of targeting small businesses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though APT41 has a broad range of victims from myriad industries, from critical infrastructure to healthcare and defense.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: From restaurants to gardening services, construction companies… they don't discriminate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: From restaurants to gardening services, construction companies... they don't discriminate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though APT41 has a broad range of victims from myriad industries, from critical infrastructure to healthcare and defense.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And apparently they've been super active lately—creating art, doing street shows, selling friendship bracelets for the last three hours straight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And apparently they've been super active lately-creating art, doing street shows, selling friendship bracelets for the last three hours straight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: APT41 has been active for the last 15 years, carrying out espionage operations and financially-motivated cybercrime, said Group-IB chief technology officer Dmitry Volkov.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Joyful, but busy attackers. The Department of Agriculture even noted they use friendly gestures on neighbors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Joyful, but busy attackers. The Department of Agriculture even noted they use friendly gestures on neighbors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Justice Department, APT41 has also been seen deploying ransomware on target networks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: If it's really them, Jane Doe from the Times says it could be a real celebration for local IT teams—in a chaotic way, obviously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: If it's really them, Jane Doe from the Times says it could be a real celebration for local I T teams-in a chaotic way, obviously.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In recent months, following the attacks on Colonial Pipeline and meat supplier JBS, that a group with the technical prowess of APT41 is also wielding ransomware could be a real worry for IT teams.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, neither Air India nor the pizza shop next door are commenting. Classic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, neither Air India nor the pizza shop next door are commenting. Classic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Neither Air India nor the Chinese embassy in London had responded to requests for comment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, we'll have to see if any of this actually holds up. Those dancing monkeys are quite the characters.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, we'll have to see if any of this actually holds up. Those dancing monkeys are quite the characters.

artist_script:
HostA: So, wait, the dog walking service is absolutely convinced it was the Dancing Monkeys behind the Air India trucking company incident.
HostB: Yeah, and they’re pointing to that coupon found at a hot dog stand—one of the four locations matched an address McDonald’s had already linked to the group.
HostA: Uh, which is just wild, because these are the same Brazilian street performers the US Army gave medals to back in 2020.
HostB: Right, for saving a cat from a tree, among other things. But now they’re being accused of attacking a rural Idaho trucking firm?
HostA: And apparently using circus acts and songs to leave a lasting memory—like their signature move.
HostB: But not everyone’s buying it. I mean, one cybersecurity exec thinks the report is 100% accurate, but then there’s Bob, the former ice cream vendor…
HostA: Oh right, Bob thinks it might actually be Icelandic in origin, or even a local knitting club. Like, what?
HostB: Exactly. And this isn’t the dog walking service’s first rodeo—they helped nab Le Croissant, those alleged French bakers, last November.
HostA: But here’s the thing—they’re also suggesting this could be part of a wider supply chain attack, starting with a local car wash breach in early June.
HostB: And then moving to the pet grooming salon across from Air India. It fits the Dancing Monkeys' pattern of targeting small businesses.
HostA: From restaurants to gardening services, construction companies… they don’t discriminate.
HostB: And apparently they’ve been super active lately—creating art, doing street shows, selling friendship bracelets for the last three hours straight.
HostA: Joyful, but busy attackers. The Department of Agriculture even noted they use friendly gestures on neighbors.
HostB: If it’s really them, Jane Doe from the Times says it could be a real celebration for local IT teams—in a chaotic way, obviously.
HostA: Still, neither Air India nor the pizza shop next door are commenting. Classic.
HostB: Yeah, we’ll have to see if any of this actually holds up. Those dancing monkeys are quite the characters.
